channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Very noisy drainage cover when traffic runs over it , service engineers were sent out on friday 21/11/2025, but i was told that they didnt have the correct stuff with them to fix it' so did as much as they could' but now it is even worse , clunking & rattling every time a car or lorry runs over it all night long' keeping us awake !! Health is now suffering from noise nuisance all day & night !, 24th November
item.description:
Outside of 52 on road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No filter on lights turning right into greyhound gardens from Elmbridge court roundabout, 24th November
item.description:
Every night I get stuck at the bottom of the golden valley bypass and it takes 39minute+ to get from there to the greyhound pub. The reason, when the new lights were installed no one thought it would be a good idea to put a filter on these lights for people turning right. This means on each light sequence multiple times no one is able to turn, this has a knock on effect on the Elmbridge court roundabout as the cars back up all the way to the bypass, I could walk this in 3 minutes, yet in the car after 10hrs at work this can take between 30-40 minutes at 5:45-6:15 pm. Absolutely ridiculous oversight. This needs sorting as it is causing a dangerous situation with cars queuing on the Elmbridge court roundabout
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nine Elms Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Resident Vehicle Parked Continuously on Vistor Space., 24th November
item.description:
2 Emerald Place There are two visitor spaces and property owner at No2 Emerald Place is claiming they own the parking spot. Persimmon have verified that the parking spots were part of planning application approved by Tewksbury Council. Occupant has been aware of this but refuses to move vehicle onto own property even though there are two parking spaces outside property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Emerald Place, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 24th November
item.description:
Email received by Cllr (attached in full): ...There is a drystone wall at the entrance to Blacksmiths Lane. This wall is a boundary for 2 Deep Street in Prestbury. Numbers 2 and 4 Deep Street belong to Gloucester County Council and are used by an outreach function of the Council. In the back garden of 2 Deep Street there are a number of very tall trees along this boundary wall. Blacksmiths Lane road surface sits several feet below the top of this boundary wall and in addition the garden of 2 Deep Street sits a bit above Blacksmiths Lane. There are telegraph poles with many telephone cable supplying telephone and broadband services to the residents of Lynworth Terrace as well as residents in other properties further up the lane. If a similar or worse storm event to the one that caused considerable damage in Church Lane were happen to the Boundary wall in Blacksmiths Lane the outcome will be severe damage to the homes in Lynworth Terrace as well as to cars which are parked along the boundary wall and to telephone/broadband services. As the trees are in the property owned by Gloucestershire County Council I believe they will be liable any damage done by such storm event and this will be considerable to say the least. (Photos attached)
Report on FixMyStreet
